docs.title: Welcome to PyPortion Docs
docs.text: PyPortion is a lightweight and developer-friendly Python CLI tool that helps you accelerate project development, keep your codebase consistent, and eliminate repetitive work.

docs.title: How does PyPortion work?
docs.text:
PyPortion works as a command-line interface (CLI) that helps you create, manage, and standardize Python projects using predefined and customizable templates.

At a high level, PyPortion follows a simple workflow:

docs.title: 1. Initialize a project
docs.text:
You start by running a PyPortion command from your terminal that creates a directory with a clean and well-structured layout based on the selected template.

  • Does that mean existing projects won’t be covered by PyPortion?

No. You can turn any existing project into a PyPortion project, and we will discuss this later.

docs.title: 2. Apply templates
docs.text: Templates define the project structure, files, and configurations. PyPortion ships with built-in templates and also allows you to create or extend your own to match your project and team standards.

docs.title: 3. Automate repetitive setup
docs.text: Common setup tasks, such as creating folders, configuration files, and base modules, are handled automatically. This removes repetitive work and ensures consistency across your projects.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🚀 Quick Start – Scaffold new projects in seconds with zero setup time
  • 🛠️ Easy Management – Maintain and organize your projects effortlessly with built-in templates
  • 📦 Clean & Consistent – Scalable architecture that stays clean, maintainable, and up to standard as you grow

docs.title: Why PyPortion?
docs.text:
• ✨ Boost your development speed
  • 🔁 Eliminate repetitive boilerplate work
  • 📏 Enforce clean and organized project structure
  • 🪶 Fast, minimal, and easy to extend

docs.title: Local Development Setup
docs.text:
In order to contribute to PyPortion code, you can follow these steps:

  1. Fork the repository Go to the GitHub repo and click "Fork" to create your own copy.

  2. Clone your fork 

    git clone https://github.com/<your-username>/pyportion

  3. Download poetry (if you don't have it) 

    curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -

  4. Install project dependencies 

    poetry install

  5. Start Development

Make your changes to the codebase. Ensure your code follows the project's coding standards and includes appropriate tests.

  1. Install Pre-Commit Hooks

Once you have completed your changes, install the pre-commit hooks: 

poetry run pre-commit install

  1. Commit and Push your changes Use git to commit and push your changes to open a pull request

docs.title: Pre-Commit Hooks
docs.text:
Pre-commit hooks run automatically when you commit changes and perform the following checks: * Format code * Lint code * Type check * Sort imports * Run test cases

Note: Pre-commit hooks may automatically modify files to match the project's coding style. If this occurs, stage and commit the changes again before pushing.

docs.title: Pull Request Review
docs.text:
All pull requests go through an automatic review via GitHub Actions, followed by a manual review.

Reviewers focus on: * Code clarity and readability * Consistency with the project structure * Test coverage * Quality and clarity of commit messages

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you have questions or need clarification, open a discussion on GitHub.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to the PyPortion User Guide. This documentation provides comprehensive instructions for installing, configuring, and using PyPortion in your Python development workflow.

docs.title: What is PyPortion?
docs.text: PyPortion is a command-line interface (CLI) tool designed to streamline Python project creation and management. It enables developers to scaffold new projects quickly using standardized templates, ensuring consistency across codebases.

docs.title: What You Will Learn
docs.text:
This guide covers the following topics:

  • Installation - How to install PyPortion on your system
  • Project Creation - How to create new projects using templates
  • Template Management - How to download, list, and use templates
  • Customization - How to create and extend templates to match your requirements

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before getting started, ensure you have the following:

  • Python 3.10 or higher installed on your system
  • Basic familiarity with the command line

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Proceed to the Get Started section to install PyPortion and create your first project.

docs.title: Get Started
docs.text: This guide walks you through installing PyPortion and using it to create your first project.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install PyPortion using pip:

pip install pyportion

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
After installation, verify that PyPortion is working correctly:

portion --version

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
To view all available commands and options, use the --help flag:

portion --help

docs.title: Working with Templates
docs.text: Templates define the structure and configuration of your projects. PyPortion provides built-in templates and supports custom templates.

docs.title: List Available Templates
docs.text:
View all templates currently available on your system:

portion template list

docs.title: Download a Template
docs.text:
Download a template from a remote repository:

portion template download <template-url>

Replace <template-url> with the URL of the template repository.

docs.title: Creating a Project
docs.text:
Once you have templates available, create a new project using the new command:

portion new <template-name> <project-name>

Parameters:

  • <template-name> - The name of the template to use
  • <project-name> - The name for your new project

Example:

portion new python-cli my-awesome-app

This command creates a new directory called my-awesome-app with the structure defined in the python-cli template.
